ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: research and python
I was given a space to fully engage with scientific research and be an integral part of my lab.

I learned how to tackle a problem in modern physics research by developing my own research plan, and got practice in communicating my results to a scientific audience at the end of the semester through presenting my research and writing a report.
Research skills
Research experience, time management, and science writing
research skills, litererature reviews, presentation skills
I learned how to give scientific talks and how to troubleshoot experiments.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: good practice for research
Perhaps it could include some feedback on the reports that we submit. Besides that, I think that the hands-off format works great.
This class is great for giving students the option to continue research and also get credit for it. This allows students to fit research into busy schedules.
Perfect structure.
Some more check ins through the semester could be helpful, but overall its strength is being exactly as promised: research for credit
Class could be improved by more clarity in expectations
A more guided experience from the PI could be useful, but that level of guidance being in the hands of the professor is a good idea, I believe, since they know each student better.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: yes, definitely
Yes! However, consider if maybe instead you want/can get paid for research. There are other avenues to research that do not involve taking a class.
Yes, you probably have to take this course but it's nice to have set time in your schedule to get research done.
If the student wants research experience, then definitely.

This is a good course to take if you wish to free up time from your normal course load to focus on research. It is difficult to make progress during the semester if you are doing research + have 4 courses.
Definitely take this if youre doing research and not getting paid for it
Yes if you're a physics major since it is required.
Yes, required course for physics major
I would recommend this course because it is nice to get credit for your work and it is also cool to see others research experiences at the end.
